Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Judge404
Reviews.Content: A grand old lady placed centrally in Berlin. Close to the Tiergarten and the Zoo - also 2 blocks from the main retail street. Staying here is easy and comfortable, but with so much heritage and grandiosity, I thought it would be somehow better. Staff are super friendly and very helpful, and pricing is very reasonable. But bathrooms need an upgrade - a bit worn looking overall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For the Price but needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Sushi_Drummer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Savoy hotel in Berlin for a business trip and when I travel to Berlin which is 3-4 times a year I like to check bargain four star hotels that is either on or on one of the adjacent streets of K-damm. Savoy gave the best price for a price conscious business traveller. It is a four star hotel. So keeping that in mind, the room was clean, and service was cortious. All good so far. There is a cigar bar attached to the reception and that's where the heavy stench of cigar smoke oozing literally choked me. I only waited at the reception for 3-5 minutes and could smell the stench on my clothes for the rest of the day. It is a clean simple decent hotel to stay for business, would definitely not stay there with frients and /or familly.

Reviews.Title: “old fashioned comfort & charm - loved it”
Reviews.Author: safaribird
Reviews.Content: After my 3rd stay at Savoy I've finally got around to sending a review. I always thoroughly enjoy my stay at this hotel. I stayed for 5 nights, mixing business meetings with some retail therapy. The rooms are old fashioned but very comfortable, clean and warm. Crisp white fresh sheets, free wifi , wonderful breakfast buffet and courteous helpful service.( only thing missing is tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms, but this could be ordered from room service from 7am. ) The hotel's own well stocked cigar bar, is an art deco style treasure , it is one of my favourite places to stop for an apperitif or after dinner drink. Location wise the hotel is fine, short walk up to the shops on Ku'dam and Kempinsky hotel area. There are plenty of newer hotels in this part of Berlin, but I always prefer to return to the Savoy because for me it offers a much more interesting ambiance and you get more of a feel of Berlin than in the generic modern hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Flyingdutch80
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with the family for 3 days. The service was excellent, the rooms were large and modern. They seem to have some rooms that need some work so make sure to ask about it during checkin

Reviews.Title: “great weekend berlin”
Reviews.Author: atjmtj
Reviews.Content: this is a great place to stay, handy for train station shopping and great food try the gecco bar if you fancy a drink and a smoke at the bar,and the meinke bar is also great and the liver and onios are to die for reccomend that dish highly staff vey polite i will return for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankandJules
Reviews.Content: Excellent bar, a bit pricey but very friendly with competent friendly staff. Good location, away from most hustle and bustle. Great cigar bear and overall an enjoyable weekend

Reviews.Title: “Faded Elegance”
Reviews.Author: cosmic_scene
Reviews.Content: We visited the Savoy Berlin in the last week of November primarily for the Christmas Markets. On the plus side this hotel is centrally located and about 5-10 minutes walk to the metro, bus station and high end department stores. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful when approached. My bed and mattress did wonders for my 15 year backache, truly! Even though freezing outside the hotel, bedroom and bathroom were very warm. Less than positive was the smell of cigar smoke from the attached cigar bar, the cost of the continental breakfast which at around £15 a day was very pricey. I recommend Cafe Swartz about 2 blocks away (turn right at theTchibo store and cross over) where we had a hearty and beautifully presented breakfast at half the price. The interior corridors of the hotel were reminiscent of the hotel in 'The Shining' and quite scary at night! My single room was at the end of a hallway adjacent to the staff stairwell. It had beautiful oriental tapestry artwork on the walls to cheer up an otherwise dark 1930's style room, an art deco floored shower room, a safe, TV, desk, chair etc and complementary mineral water each day. The curtains didn't hide the cracked plasterwork and the windows were quite drafty and for non-city dwellers the noise from a nearby metro bridge as well as the bar/restaurant across the way would be distruptive to a good night's sleep - I found it quite comforting in an otherwise too quiet hotel. Most annoying for a modern city was the lack of free WiFi with the exception of Starbucks. The hotel only offers a computer in Reception and charged daily for WiFi. The posh McDonald's showed off their iPads but did not offer WiFi to customers. As this was my first visit to Berlin I was initally disappointed by the greyness around me but the people were lovely and very helpful. I preferred East Berlin for its pre and post war history, what little remains of its jewish past, the architecture and its overall timelessness especially around Alexanderplatz, the Berlin Cathedral and Museum Island where there are magical Christmas Markets nearby. Checkout the huge circular aquarium at the Radisson Blu Hotel! For the first time ever, I did not take one photo of my room or the hotel and I had my new Panasonic Lumix to hand at all times! I think that this hotel trades on its name and should like its older sister on the Strand in London have its interior gutted and refurbished for the 21st century traveller and include breakfast and WiFi as standard.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: SalvatoreEsposito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location but, the rooms are tired and outdated. I was shocked when i entered the room for the first time. The 80's look and feel... Sometimes i find old hotels charming but this hotel just felt tired. :-(

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimmyTam
Reviews.Content: My husband and 4 year old daughter stayed here in mid Dec 2011. The hotel room was very big with plenty of room for an extra bed (no extra charge) and still loads of room. Nice corner area with sofa and chair so we could eat of our take out currywurst and ships. Bathroom was huge. We did not have breakfast at the hotel (a little expensive) and we found a little cafe on the right out of the hotel over the road that did breakfast and the 3 of us ate for the price of 1 at the hotel. Also on that road is a great Austrian restaurant called Ottenthal which even on a Sunday was packed so best to book. Under the train arches was a nice italian restaurant. There is also a big supermarket between the hotel and the Zoo S Bahn that was open on Sundays too. The hotel is near to the Zoologische Garten U and S Bahn and the Uhlandstrasse S Bahn. Our visit was mostly for the Xmas markets and there was one within walking distance of the hotel near to the Zoo. Ask for the code for wifi at reception - access was free. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old time style hotel, like it!”
Reviews.Author: Ellviss2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 night before X-mas, to visit Christmas markets and do som shopping. Very nice hotel, loved the sigarbar and the nice staff, and also the room was nice and big, even if it could do with some upgrading. Location perfect for us, close to bus, S- and U-bahn, with som really nice shops and restaurant/bars near by. Will return next time in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel very well situated in a quiet street near Ku´damm”
Reviews.Author: landin802
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel with genuine charm and with very nice and helpful staff. The cozy smoking bar with a lot of drinks was something we valued. If you don´t smoke you can have the drink in the lobby or in the resturant. Our room was big and clean with comfortable beds and the bathroom was fancy and luxury. Many international channels on the TV. The restaurant was beautiful with excellent food and wines. We were very satisfied with our 5-night stay at this hotel. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in and we travel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with character and history”
Reviews.Author: MortimerOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from another week at the Savoy Hotel and it remains as enjoyable as ever providing a refreshing antidote to the anonymous 'could-be-anywhere-in-the-world' hotels one finds so often. The location is great, the breakfast remains one of the nicest and most civilised, and the staff are, as always, very helpful. Yes, the rooms are not the lap of luxury but they are perfectly comfortable. All the comments I made in my review of August 2009 continue to be valid.

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with superb location in the heart of Berlin. Staff at reception are very serviceminded and professional. Rooms are quiet, private and spotless clean. Many international channels on the tv. I'm very satisfied with my 4-night stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with some "faded charm"”
Reviews.Author: Schwartzenegger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located close to the Zoo Station. Easy accessible with bus nr 109 from the Tegel airport. Takes appr. 10 min. On a walking distance to the Kurfürstendamm. It has probably been a more fashionable hotel in the past but is still quite "high standard". We had booked a suite with the "Travelmore.com"-site for two nights. Unfortunately the Savoy Hotel said they didn't have any information about that. They where fully booked and we got a very ordinary room instead the first night. As a compensation we were offered a "free" breakfast one morning. Lesson learned: always check with the hotel itself that they have got your reservation right before going there. It has happened to me a couple of times that reservations have not worked. What has worked always is the withdrawal of my money from my bank account. Strange that never fails... The first room was average but clean and okay as such. The suite we got the other night was very nice and absolutely well worth the money. Not that big but a separate living room, working space and bedroom. A very fancy bathroom that gave a taste of luxury. The feeling we had expected arriving the friday night to celebrate my birthday. Breakfast in the morning was very good, nothing more to ask for and kind people serving. The overall impression: not so fancy as the web site promises, but absolutely ok and a good choice for a weekend stay. The web site, by the way, otherwise is very informative and there is a lot of good tips about what you can do, what to see on a distance of 500m, 1 km, 2 km etc.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Eigil
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay here at the hotel, even though the people in the reception failed to understand our problem with the hotel safe. Excellent location as we liked the area and Savigny platz. Room service was swift and efficient. We enjoyed the sigar bar as the champagne was lovely and cheap compared to Norway.

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere, minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadsrl
Reviews.Content: Savoy is classy and somehow impressive, but I won't insist on the good parts, as they were already mentioned by various other reviewers. Here are the flaws I could identify during my short stay (2 nights): - the hallways (even on the 4th floor) stink of cigars; luckly the rooms do not; - poor soundproofing. I could here not only the trains, but also some German speaking lady who had a fight with someone for more than an hour late in the night (could not understand her German, but the crying was quite international); - overheating. There is no climatization system installed and the only way to get rid of the annoying heat was to open the balcony door. At freezing temperatures and after taking a shower, it was not a very smart idea, but the only working one, as I could not figure out how to turn down the classic heater in the room (no sign for on/off and actually no idea if it was working or not) - very, but very soft mattress. Still, I enjoyed my stay despite these issues and that was due to the nice, classy atmosphere of the hotel. A special mention goes to the breakfast, with a lovely variety of foods.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near train station and shops”
Reviews.Author: Siniffe
Reviews.Content: Nice room in a classy hotel. Reasonably priced too. Location was perfect for us to see Berlin and do some shopping

Reviews.Title: “first class”
Reviews.Author: van035
Reviews.Content: had a very nice stay at the Savoy. Only had breakfast but it was good. The staff were very helpful and attentive and took us to the lift and then to our room. Central hotel. Vanessa

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming old world charm at the Savoy”
Reviews.Author: JKay3
Reviews.Content: If you like to stay somewhere that has a touch of old world charm, home from home comfort, an unassuming aura, replete with polite staff, the Savoy is your kind of place. Myself and partner stayed for five nights in late October 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Nearing the end of our time at the Savoy, we began to feel like locals returning home after a long day sight-seeing. We had a room at the back of the hotel, facing onto the parking lot and a private apartment block - was super quiet night and day. We had rented an economy room which was one of the biggest basic rooms I've ever stayed in with the nice bonus of a small hall area to hang up your coat. It seems to draw a multi-generational eclectic type of guest which was also nice to see. Completely recommend - not a whiff of generic hotel about it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service from such a well known name”
Reviews.Author: craig0austin
Reviews.Content: We booked the savoy as it is a name that is known for luxury and good service. We arrived and were booked into a junior suit which was nothing more than we had expected. We requested Internet access as it was listed in the rooms facilities, to which reply was barked back to us that there was a fee and we should check the details, which we did. When we requested to see the manager we were told that there wasn't one available to see us. My partner and I were shocked and extremely disatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, but make sure you get the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: yuliaT
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great interior design and is located on a quiet street, 10 minutes walk from the kurfurstendamm strasse. We had three rooms: one double and two singles. I asked for a quiet room - I got a large new room with a big shiny bathroom and good air-condition, in the newly decorated section of the hotel. The others had rooms that were not renovated (yet?). The double room was smaller than my single room and the air-condition did not work. The Breakfast was expensive - 20 EURO and not worth the money in my opinion. In summary: great hotel, but make sure you get the renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonuk23075
Reviews.Content: Young friendly staff who went out of their way to make my stay stress free and enjoyable.Nice sauna.Great, atmospheric bar.Clean comfortable rooms.Absolutely no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with no AC”
Reviews.Author: JJShank
Reviews.Content: This room was interesting and the largest room we had the entire stay. It was nice but it had no AC and that day it rained and then it was hot so not a good combo. If you are staying in the summer I would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No review can take the charm away of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Misstravelling
Reviews.Content: In my life (I am 40+) I have stayed in many different hotels, from cheap and nasty, to five star luxurious boutique hotels. Savoy is different from any hotels I know: Genuine charm! You might not notice it at first, but give it time, as well as yourself, stay a couple of nights and you will notice why modernization is not always the answer to every problem, nor the first impression. I have stayed in this hotel many times, you get some really good deals during the summer season and around Christmas through almost any search engine. The rooms are big, some still have "old fashioned" bathrooms, beds are very good, the service is perfect and discreet, breakfast is very tasty. The dining room, where the breakfast is served, is one of the nicest I have ever been too, with an interesting style (especially if you are interested in art and interiors). In the evening the dining room turns into a restaurant, with excellent food and wines. I could go on and on, but the rest should be experienced personally! how time and history has

Reviews.Title: “truly accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ruoloc
Reviews.Content: both the service and rooms were excellent. the location was tranquil, but close to everything to almost everything. I would come back to the savoy on future trip to berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, elegant, cozy”
Reviews.Author: EDR22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Savoy several times, to the point where it seems like a home away from home. Conveniently situated on a pleasant street off the KuDamm, a few blocks from three U-bahn stops, it retains a level of unpretentious Old World elegance not often seen. The rooms are medium-sized, and spotlessly clean. Back rooms lack air conditioning, but look out on the pleasant courtyard. Breakfasts are bountiful, served in the brilliantly red-decored restaurant. The staff is pleasant and efficient. One complaint: the fitness room is not worthy of that name: just a couple of treadmills. Overall: a wonderful place for an extended visit in this marvelous city.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: withanie
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Savoy, and it met all our expectations. We did request a room on the air conditioned floor (glad we did as it was very warm in Berlin duringour stay). Slight confusion at check-in regarding AC room, but quickly resolved. Room on smallish side, but very comfortable, clean, plenty of storage and AC worked. Breakfast options plentiful and all very fresh. Bar is a 'smoking bar' which is awful, but if weather is good sitting outside is better option.

Reviews.Title: “Not for summer, definitely. Otherwise fine.”
Reviews.Author: Lasselanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near Kantstrasse, close to Kurfuerstendamm and whithin 3-minute walk from an S-Bahn/U-Bahn station (Zoologischer Garten), which means its location is perfect. At least, if you don't get a room, facing Fasanenstrasse - the soundproof is rather poor, so the street noise does interfere with the peace and quiet of a truly spacious, comfortable and cosy room. Especially if you open a window. And you have to open the window because there is no air conditioning, and when summer is pressing heavily, the air inside is soggy and thick. And this is the weakest point of this hotel, so I believe it feels fabulous in colder weather. The room is pleasantly, yet simply decorated; the bathroom is one of the most convenient ones in my experience; everything is clean and tidy. Breakfast is rich and delicious, it can satisfy any fancy, to my mind. The staff is friendly, although a bit unversed in advising on cultural events and places, which are not listed in a top-10 of the sights. Still it's easily amendable, because the Internet is available in the lobby, and you may use their computer to set a cultural programme for yourself. By the way, there is a cigar bar in the same building (no smell in the hotel) - for someone it can be a plus. I wouldn't stay there again in summer, but I'd recommend to consider this option for autumn, winter and spring.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, classy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: rbux
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, nicely appointed and incredibly quiet for an urban hotel. Contrary to a previous review, this is not a smokers hotel, but rather, a hotel with a smoking lounge adjacent to the lobby. On check-in we noticed smoke but our floor was entirely non smoking and we never smelled a hint of smoke. Has a cool old world feel which was such as nice change from your cookie-cutter Holiday Inns. And kudos to Bodo Wulfhert:, the concierge, who kindly negotiated a great price for same-say concert tickets, then sent a lad to retrieve them for us. Another plus, the hotel is in a well-centered location with easy access to bus, S-Bahn, U-bahn and great nearby restaurants. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel if you are into old furniture, but in good shape”
Reviews.Author: The2ndMouse
Reviews.Content: As the title says. The furniture and the building is old, but they do not seem to be neglected or in lack of a makeover. It is used in a clever way to show how old furniture can have some class (for a 4 star hotel of course ... dont expect any Luis XV pieces!) It is an old building too but clean. The location is OK and the service OK too. The only drawbacks I can think of is the lower than expected quality of the bed and no free internet in the rooms (only in the lobby)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mrd1352
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We stayed for 3 nights in March 2011. Close to trains and close to the Ku'damm. Also near the zoo, although we did not visit the zoo. No complaints at all, would stay here again if I ever get to return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This is our second stay”
Reviews.Author: AthensDeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a number of years ago and loved it. The location is perfect, close to trains, buses, restaurants and great shopping. Our room was lovely with a great bathroom. The staff were all helpful, pleasant and professional. We might not stay again because of the breakfast. On our first visit it was included and the buffet is to die for. This time it wasn't included and it's euro 19 a person and if you just want coffee and toast you have to take the whole thing. The bar is great but the hotel is not for people that can't stand the smell of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Turbofletch75
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin for work and stayed here. Great room, great staff and a location that can't be beat. If smoking bothers you, don't come here...or to Germany for that matter> I will always come back here! True Euro hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Smokers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmykranke
Reviews.Content: Took the family back to Berlin after a 20yr absence. Selected the Savoy, as it was well priced and close to the Ku-Damn and the Blue Church area, it is steeped in the history of the city. On arrival however, you find the hotel is average, no wow factor. The rooms are small and a little tired looking. The room was fairly clean and quiet, the beds comfortable. Pros: Location. Excellently placed to get into the hub of the city, with many fine bars and eating places nearby. A great bagel shop within 2 mins walk for breakfast on Kant Strasse. Cons: At checkin, they placed my family in a smoking room(we had requested Non-Smoking). The hotel only has a cigar bar, so if you don't smoke, it make life a little uncomfortable. The hotel reeks of smoke. I would not use it again because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: hamman1
Reviews.Content: The Savoy had just the right atmosphere for a chilly and snowy December stay. So many hotels we looked at on the booking sites were designer or art hotels with what appeared to be bare white rooms. We really wanted something warmer looking for the time of year. We typed in 'cosy hotels in Berlin' on Google, the Savoy was one of those listed, and the rates were excellent value for money. Our room was a good size and definitely nice & warm and cosy. Be warned though that the hotel's website says all Superior rooms have a bathtub but ours didn't - I suspect they gave us the wrong class of room at check-in. Nevertheless the staff were very obliging about moving us and we were very satisfied with the new room. The other tip is that if you want to avoid paying €19 for breakfast there is an excellent cafe less than 50 metres away the junction where you will pay around a quarter of that. Don't let that detract from the hotel though, its an excellent place to stay and the location in a quiet street close to the Ku'dam, Zoo station and plenty of restaurants is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect the London Savoy!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloManchester
Reviews.Content: Situated on a fairly quiet street not far from Ku'damm, the hotel doesn't look too grand from the outside. Rooms were well-appointed and the service was excellent, but the whole place looks a bit tired and dated. Our room on the second floor had plenty of storage space and a large bathroom which was, unfortunately, decorated in dark green tiles with an oyster-coloured suite! Large windows opened directly onto the street, but were double-glazed to keep out the noise. The other members of our party had to change rooms as the heating in their first room could not be adjusted, but the change was made with no trouble. Breakfast, at 19.50 Euros was substantial and delicious and set us up nicely for the day ahead. The Savoy is probably worth its 4 stars based on service, but the rooms and the general decoration let the place down slightly. However, it's a well-located hotel, ten minutes walk from the Zoo station and although it wouldn't be my first choice, I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Older Hotel but a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and picked this location because it was central and near the zoo which seemed like a good place to be. We unfortunately arrived at 6am from an over night train and had no choice but to leave our bags and sit around and wait for anything in the near area to open after 9am. We also had to come back to check in at 3pm, so we went to the zoo until the afternoon and we could check in. Upon checking in we were pretty pleased with the size and spaciousness of the room, having a couch, chairs and two beds and a huge bathroom (for Europe) so we felt we made a good choice. We then found out that internet is not included in the rate, and you have to pay PER device to have access to it. Being that my husband run an internet business this was extremely frustrating not being able to just pay for access for both computers. The internet problems got worse, it kept dropping the signal from one of our brand new Macbooks and then every time our computer went to sleep it would not let us back on the internet, it's like it thought it was a security issue or something and we couldn't even get to the main page to sign in. We basically had to use only 1 computer for our stay here and bought multiple internet packages trying to get the other one to work to no avail. The other problem, was the confusing information from the front staff. When we asked about internet prices we were told on the phone it was 1 hour or 5 hours, so we ended up buying consecutive 5 hour packages because no one told us until we left that we could have access for 24 hours for 10 euros instead of 5 hours for 7 euros! Also I inquired on a city tour and a man working the night shift told me to just come down any time in the morning and they would sell us tickets and give us a brochure for a tour they run every 50 minutes. Well the next day we go down and another man tells us the tours are ONLY at 10 am and 2pm and we have to wait! We asked where to go and he gives us an address of number 217 on a street 2 blocks away. So we went for lunch and then decided to go look for this supposed bus stop. Which we did not get the name of by the way. Then we see 3 different companies of busses, with people selling tickets everywhere, so now it's looking like there are tours all day and we were misinformed that there was only a tour twice a day! We bought a tour and found out the busses come every 10 minutes until 6pm... It would have been nice to do the tour earlier since it proceeded to rain the rest of the day and we basically saw the whole city from inside the bus without getting off because of the rain. I am really not sure if there is some sort of communication issue, since they speak English there, and my husband was speaking German to them, but it seems like we kept getting the run around and confusing information from the front desk staff. I would have to say that since it's their job to give the right information they need to work on that. At least suggest the same tour, not each person give different information when being asked about a standard city tour! We decided against staying at a hotel owned by the same company on our trip to Munich because of the internet being extra. We cannot take chances with having problems and not being able to work and paying for this. So we selected a higher end hotel that included internet. Another note someone was either smoking on the second floor or there was a lot of cigar smoke wafting down the hallway we could smell it all in our room and this was disconcerting as well.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: MortimerOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on my own and with friends and family on numerous occasions and have always had a great the stay. Three elements in particular go to make it enjoyable: it feels like a family run hotel rather than a cloned establishment created by a big chain; the staff are very helpful and friendly; the breakfast is a wonderful spread of good quality food served in an elegant and peaceful environment. The hotel is located in the Fasanenstrasse, which transects the Ku'damm. It is just a few minutes walk from the Bahnhof Zoo and Savigny Platz U- and S-Bahn stations which means one is on a direct route to Berlin Mitte and Schönefeld airport in one direction and Potsdam and Wannsee in the other (the same lines run through both Zoo and Savigny Platz stations). The Ku'damm shopping area is also just a few minutes walk. The public parts of the hotel itself are decorated in a rich red colour. Rooms are pleasantly but done but I wouldn't describe them as luxurious. The bathrooms in some of the rooms I have stayed in are a bit dated but everything functions perfectly. TV had channels in various languages; the minibar had a decent choice of beverages. The breakfast, as mentioned above, is excellent and, although it is a buffet, it is an eminently civilsed affair and there is never any queueing and nothing ever seems to run out. There is a wide choice (even for me, a fussy eater) and everything looked very fresh. Slightly oddly, there is free champagne but if one wants freshly squeezed fruit juice there is an extra charge. I travelled with my dog and, as always, he was made very welcome by staff. The hotel has a high end cigar bar. Although it is sealed off from the rest of the public areas there is a faint smell of cigar smoke, although I personally found this rather pleasant. A final point - one aspect I like about the hotel is it's history: many film stars have been there in the past and their names are indicated on the doors of the rooms in which they stayed. During the Second World War, the hotel was taken over as the Japanese embassy when the original one got bombed and then, after the end of the war, it was for a while British Army HQ. So there is a bit of a kick in staying in a place which is so full of history, particularly in Berlin. The Although wi-fi access is not free the hotel has a special business package which includes breakfast, 24hr wi-fi and 24hr parking for €21.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware: hotel is under construction”
Reviews.Author: NLTraveler030
Reviews.Content: The outdated rooms of the hotel are currently being renovated. When we arrived the 5th floor was covered in plastic and workmen were making lots of noise between 9 am and 6 pm. Including weekends. Quite annoying. The hotel did not mention the renovations on the website and the management was not able to change us do a more quiet room. Also be aware on hot days: The rooms do not have air conditioning or proper ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely individual hotel”
Reviews.Author: KFF77
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. So nice to stay somewhere that isn't some bland, modern hotel. Rooms are huge and nicely furnished and very well maintained. Sauna is a bonus. Restaurant was expensive, so ate elsewhere. One thing I would say was the reception staff could do with a lesson on service and hospitality. My stay at the hotel was extended because of the volcanic ash cancelling all flights, but the staff on reception could not have been less help, and totally humourless to boot. Having said that I'd definitely stay here again, lovely hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: Jostein
Reviews.Content: The hotel is indeed nice and stylish building. Perfect location, just off Ku´Damm. But be aware of all the hidden extras; EU19.- for breakfast is a rip-off. So is EUR 10 per day for internet. On the bright side is the wonderful cigarbar attached to the lobby. Great atmosphere, beautiful interior and great drinks / cigars!

Reviews.Title: “Very intimate, very nice”
Reviews.Author: s_moroder
Reviews.Content: I was in Berlin on business and stayed at the Savoy for several nights. Loved the lobby area that takes you back in time. The breakfast room / restaurant is stunning with red walls and chairs, white stucco and beautiful lusters. The breakfast buffet makes you think you're actually at a five-star hotel. Staff was overall extremely friendly and helpful. (One of the best experiences I've had in a long time, actually). The room they gave me was large and comfortable; however, renovating the rooms wouldn't hurt. The entire experience was just so great that I looked at the old furniture as part of the peculiar charme of the hotel. I'll definitely come back the next time I'm in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “A great historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: lAURIE URANE
Reviews.Content: Stayed thre two nigts. it is oneof the oldrst hotels in berlin , a couple of blocks from Zoo station It survived the war som how and its art deco facede and interior is charming.The roome are furnished wel, german comfort and rhe buffet breakfast is huge. Dinner in the dining room is not bad eithe. The staff are friendly and helpful It is in walking distance fro Zoo station , and the old burnt and bommed church, Good transport and good shoppinging nearby It a great small hotel and not what you would expect in Berlin Stay there again. Has aunusual bar and Cigar room

Reviews.Title: “-6 outside but the Savoy offers a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: jules093
Reviews.Content: Warm,friendly,clean hotel.Nice room and lovely varied breakfast. Booked through GTA hotels which I have used before and never been disappointed. Being smokers it was nice to take advantage of the hotels cigar lounge which is sited just off reception and although drinks were on the pricey side it was nice to enjoy a coffee and liquer in ambient surroundings. The hotel is ideally situated for restaurants and shops (we enjoyed browsing through Ka De Wa which is the German equivelant to Harrods and has a lovely coffee lounge and food hall) On Sundays most of the main shops were shut but that may just have been because it was out of season so we decided to do the tourist trail and see the sights. A double decker tourist bus just around the corner from the hotel takes you to Checkpoint Charlie,Brandenburg gate and Berlins historical places of interest and is well worth the 15 euros as the trip takes about 2 hours. All in all Berlin is a city well worth a second visit and we will have no hesitation in staying at the Savoy on our return!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Professor32
Reviews.Content: This friendly, well kept hotel is a gem. From the hearty welcome and pleasant rooms to the sumptious and delicious breakfast (included) one 's needs are catered to. The location is within walking distance to the Kurfuerstendamm, the zoo, the S-Bahn and a main bus terminal, and across from the Ottental, one of the finest restaurants in Berlin, in the event that you want a change from the delicious hotel food. Most tourists stay near the Potsdamer Platz or in the "east" which makes this location doubly charming, yet convenient. The Savoy is our "refuge" in Berlin and we return often, knowing that the same gracious personnel will be there to greet us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because the hotel which I had originally booked had some issues with its water system, so we were rebooked into Savoy. The first impression once you enter the hotel - wow, it does look posh and chic. If you have read Christie's stories from 1920s, you will get a clear picture of how this hotel looks like. A lot of glass, dark red carpets. The rooms are large, very clean. The 19 EUR breakfast is a great offer, though one can have a decent breakfast in Berlin for 50% of this price. The location is great, too, only minutes away from the buses for TXL airport and a stroll away from shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Nice staff and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: occorsue
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year. The room was clean and cute, with valuable equipment. The staff there were really nice (even they looked a little bit serious...). The location was also good, and there was a supermarket nearby so that we could buy everything we wanted conveniently. When we suffered the problem of our flight just one day before leaving, they spent a lot of time, helped us to contact with our airline company very warmly. Worth a stay! p.s. The only deficit was the charge of the internet....not so cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: don't-travel-enough
Reviews.Content: The Savoy was exactly what we wanted for our (too brief) trip to Berlin. The room was very comfortable and well maintained. We had a lovely view of the courtyard. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was helpful and spoke excellent English. The location was great. The hotel is very near many restaurants and cafes. The main shopping street in Berlin is only a few blocks away and it was very easy to get to three different subway lines as well as the S-bahn trains.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and old-fashioned”
Reviews.Author: crazybeavers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2009 for our wedding, first in a standard room and then in the Greta Garbo Suite. The rooms were very pretty in an old-fashioned, cozy way, very clean, and the service was quite friendly. There was one disappointing thing though: We were told when we booked that we could have the room on our wedding day until the afternoon and the staff would move our luggage to the suite when we are away. But when the day came, we were told at noon when we were busy dressing and preparing everything that we would have to move to the suite right away because they needed the room for the next guest. This, of course, added a lot of stress to our wedding day. Besides this, everything was very nice, though and worth the (not so low price). The location is also quite good and very central, next to the Zoo and the Gedächtniskirche, although there are nicer quarters in the city centre. There is very cheap parking across the street for only 5 Euro a day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Snobby Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: riggingdiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Maybe we were not yet used to the "efficient" Germans, but many of the front desk staff here were nearly openly rude to Americans - and talking about us in German - assuming that we could not understand them. (Europeans should note: just because someone cannot speak your language does not mean that they cannot understand what is being said.) And they did not have that much to be snobby about - while we were given our room early after arriving from a stop in Dublin - one would hardly call it a 4 star hotel room. The bathroom, while clean, had old lady tile and exposed PVC sticking out into the floor around the tub. The hotel seemed deserted. The fitness room in the basement was a plus. Great sauna and showers. We never ate the hotel breakfast (@ nearly $30?!?) Walk less than 5 minutes to Schwartz' Cafe for a great local flavored Berlin spot with excellent breakfast at around $12. Also, lots of great restaurants in the area PLUS the ZOO!! For the 85 euro/ night we paid, the location near the restaurants and trains - it was worth the money. Also, the internet connection in the free hotel computer takes FOREVER to connect to US servers - beware!

Reviews.Title: “Out-dated”
Reviews.Author: leannenufc
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Savoy Berlin for two nights in July 08 and we found it to be a very average hotel. The location of the hotel is not the best-in hindsight, I think it would have been better to have stayed in the east of the city, as this was where we spent the majority of our time. Walking from the hotel to the Brandenburg Gate took well over an hour, and while we prefer walking in cities to taking public transport, many others will find the S-Bahn a must! That's not to say that the Savoy is badly located for tourists-the Ku'Damm and Kaiser Wilhelm Church are big attractions, and only five minutes away-but there are better areas to use as a base. We also found the area around the nearby Europa Centre to be quite uncomfortable at times, with gangs of rowdy teenagers going out of their way to bother the tourists walking around. The hotel itself is on quite an unattractive street, and the exterior doesn't really bring to mind the impression it likes to give of a luxury celebrity dwelling. Once inside, things are a lot grander, but it all feels quite old-fashioned with the impression of trying to live off past glories. The reception area is also very smoky and fuggy from the adjacent cigar room. We found the reception staff to be friendly and efficient though, and not as snobby as I was worried they'd be on walking in! The room itself was very big for the price (the bathroom was especially large, especially in comparison to a lot of similarly-priced hotels around the continent) and clean, but like the lobby, it felt rather faded and old. The dark mahogany around the room was clearly meant to make it look grander than it was, and it all just felt a bit desperate. It was comfortable, and like I said, the size of the room was excellent, but it was all just a little false and strange. Amenities-wise, there was free bottled water, bathrobes and toiletries, a mini-bar and the TV had a number of English speaking channels. However, despite being listed when we booked, there was no in-room safe. We did not try the restaurant or bar, but they seemed to be fairly busy in the evenings when we passed by. We picked the Savoy because of an excellent deal on Expedia-it was around £55 a night, which was by far one of the better prices for a summer stay in Berlin-and some decent reviews on tripadvisor. We certainly weren't unhappy with our choice, but we were just left quite uninspired and indifferent to it. Although we wouldn't complain against staying there again if we had to, it's very unlikely that we will choose it on our next visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Savor the Savoy”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCitySueSteve
Reviews.Content: Christmas in Berlin was a wonderful experience here. Little gifts everyday of our stay made it easier to be away from home during the holiday. A huge decorated Cristmas tree and poinsettias in the lobby was enhanced by the deep red walls and wallpaper and crystal chandeliers. Elegant 1920's furnishings made the lobby a comfortable place to relax after museum hopping with a drink and a book while watching the world bustle by outside the window. The German staff was attentive to our requests without exception. Complimentary bottles of water and chocolates daily was good and the mini poinsettia and tin of chocolates made us smile. We enjoyed the ease of proximity to museums and good restaurants. A cigar bar off the lobby worried us until we discovered it did not offend our non-smoking sensibilities. The bathroom here was spacious, but a disabled person (me) would have trouble with the very deep tall tub. Another comfortable chair in the room, there's one, would be a plus We only ate one breakfast here because we slept in, but its a bit expensive. A croissant and coffee around the corner was convenient and good at half the price. There are abundant taxis here but the U-bahn is cheaper and gets you most everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: the_oslo_gooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights, and were VERY satsified with the hotel. Service at the reception was efficient and welcoming. Our room (#110) was BIG, with lounge area and a four poster bed.Bathroom was big, and had a combined shower/hoth tub. Furniture and decor of room was a bit dated though. There is a restaurant and cigar lounge on premises. Location is very good; subway, several restaurants and shopping area within a 7 minutes stroll. Highly recommended ! PS! Our rate was "early internet booking" (or something like that), and did not include breakfast. The breakfast was good, but at €19 expensive. There are several cafes and coffee shops nearby catering for breakfast needs at a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Reitchel
Reviews.Content: Feeling free to recommend, this hotel surprised me and made me happy for four Berliner days and nights. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: Behind a relatively modest exterior you will find a really nice hotel. Good reception and lobby area with PC with free Internet access. We were upgraded to a very spacious room. Furniture and decor is a little dated but all very well maintained. Good bed and chairs, good bathroom. Breakfast buffet has several hot dishes and a good choice of bread and rolls. Also had a couple of meals in the restaurant during our stay and it was excellent both for lunch and dinner. Cosy bar next to the reception has an excellent choise of both cigars and beverages. Staff is courteous and efficient and the location is perfect and central if you want to explore Berlin. I can really recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “nice room, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Tecalli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy for 3 nights after booking a superior room on Travelocity ($124/night). The hotel is in a great location a short 5 min. walk from the S-bahn and the U. The room was very large and comfortable-- a sitting area beside the bedroom and a large bathroom. Other nice touches were the very friendly and helpful staff and the free internet access in the lobby. For both the location and the room size/quality, we thought this was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: TippExplorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Savoy for 3 nights in July. We selected the hotel on the basis of tripadvisor reviews. The hotel itself is very conveniently located for the Ku'damm and the zoo. The rooms are quite small, but are clean and comfortable. The decor is a little bit dated. On the downside, there is no air conditioning and as the temperatures were up on 31 celcius during our stay this was a problem. Added to this, there is quite a bit of noise from the street and from the nearby rail line. On the plus side, and it was a big plus, the breakfast was excellent, with a huge array of choices, promptly replenished by very smartly dressed, polite staff. For the price we paid, this was a very good hotel and I would be happy to reccomend it for a short stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, clean large room with outdated decor”
Reviews.Author: mgjazz
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Berlin in May. Everything about the hotel was good, while the location was great. Short walks to K-damm, Savignyplatz, and zoo. Enjoyed the hospitality and helpfulness of the Savoy Berlin staff. Staff gave accurate restaurant and transportation recommendations, and dry cleaning was performed timely and skillfully. Enjoyed the size of the room and bathroom. But I was quite surprised at the decor of the room - seemed like it hadn't been updated since the 80's. But to us, this didn't matter. Space, cleanliness, large functional bathroom, and new bed made up for the somewhat odd decor of the room. Also liked the nice touch of having a bottle of mineral water in the room. Comfortable large and clean. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Savoy Berlin is Charming”
Reviews.Author: ThunderBay-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews from this website - which were seemingly excellent. We were pleased with the hotel for the most part and I found the hotel filled with old world charm - which we like. If you are looking for North American type hotels - this one isn't for you. Our room was quite large and quaint and overlooked the outdoor patio. We awoke to birdsongs every morning and it was a lovely start to the day. The beds, although European in style, were quite comfortable. The bathroom was large, but quaint. I don't think the hotel has air conditioning - if it does, it has no obvious temperature controls in the room. Some reviewers compained about noise, but we had our windows open and found the room to be quiet. The hotel guests seemed to be mainly German speaking - so this hotel did not appear to cater to North American tourists per se, but the staff speak English and communication was not an issue. On the other hand, I did not go on vacation to have a North American experience - if we wanted that we would have stayed home. So this hotel fit my needs very well - it was a slice of Europe. Some reviewers have compained about the cigar bar off the lobby and the accompanying cigar odor. We did not find the smell of cigars to be particularily strong or offensive. So it was not an issue. What was shocking was the price of breakfast. Our room rate did not include breakfast (if you stay here - make sure it's included before you eat there) and when the bill came it was 19 Euro per person - my cereal and croissant cost almost $30....But, its Europe and I should have known. For the rest of our stay, we walked half a block to a lovely coffee shop for pastries and deliciously european coffee - under 10 Euro for two. The hotel has a convenient location - it is near many restaurants and small coffee shops, only two blocks from Ku'damm and the upscale shops therein, and within walking distance of many attractions. The area has undergone rennovation and you will find lovely shops, restraurants, bars, and theatres within mere blocks of the hotel. It is less than a half hour from the airport and only blocks to buses and trains. This hotel was a pleasure to stay in and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected - cute!”
Reviews.Author: J_HenNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor after booking elsewhere in Berlin, and actually changed my reservation over to this hotel becasue it was cheaper AND rated better. I was not disappointed! The rooms are gorgeous, comfortable, spotlessly clean and come with handy things you wouldn't expect, like a bidet (!) and a trouser press. The staff are really helpful, polite and friendly, and the rates reasonable. The hotel is in very convenient walking distance from several train and bus lines. I would not hesistate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: IdaOslo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a longweekend in Berlin. We stayed at the Savoy hotell in Fasanenstrasse and really enjoyed the location. It's a short walk to the U-/S-Bahn and to central Ku'Damm. There are lots of restaurants close to the hotel. And the staff is great and always helpful. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. We didn't have breakfast included, but it was no problem finding a place to eat breakfast within a short walking distance to the hotel. We recommend this hotell if you want a nice, central stay without spending too much money.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Ophelia89
Reviews.Content: I would have to say I'm surprised at the rave reviews on this website. I was not at all happy with this hotel, and I have stayed several places in Berlin. Despite booking what was described as a superior room, my room was very small, and noisy due to the major road and train tracks just outside my window. My bed only had one pillow, my bathroom only one towel, and a smoky smell from the hall, even though I have a nonsmoking room. I would definitely recommend the Swissotel in W Berlin, or the Marriott Courtyard in E Berlin over the Savoy. Both have much more comfortable, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An old berlin institution, great pick”
Reviews.Author: Cherryyu
Reviews.Content: I stayed Savoy for two nights. The location is really convenient to use any public transport (400m from Zoo Station)and two blocs away from KUFUDAMM. The front desk was always polite as well as effieicent. The room decor was a classy, and yet cosy. very good after a long walking day in Berlin. My single room has a huge bathroom and a balcony. Some previous reviewers complained about the smoke released from the Cigar bar. It was not too heavy in my room since I aksed for non-smoking one. Breakfest is average, It did have a good selection but a bit pricey 19euros since you can have a decent breakfest in any Kaffee in Berlin. I do recommand Kaffee Einstein. Overall, I will stay Hotel Savoy again for my next Berlin trip for its location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Respite”
Reviews.Author: tramvay
Reviews.Content: Definitely not the place to stay if what you're looking for is ultra-modern chic, the hotel exudes an air of fading glamour and days gone by. The lobby, bar and restaurant are as grand as you'd expect from such a place, though cosy enough to feel homely. Our room was suitably large with high ceilings to match. Although the decor seems woefully outdated, it actually made a refreshing change to be staying somewhere with a character of its own, a place that didn't feel like it might have been assembled entirely from flatpack kits from Ikea. Spotlessly clean, the room was fresh and temperatures perfectly set centrally to offset the climate outside. The bathroom was also immaculately kept, but I did notice one out of place tile that really should have been fixed long ago. There were only two things about the room I didn't like. Firstly, although they supply one complimentary bottle of mineral water a day, there are no tea / coffee making facilities. Secondly, one of our bedside cabinets had an old radio built into it that had strangely been disconnected. Was a bit of a shame, because listening to local stations on a retro radio would have added to the overall atmosphere greatly. Staff were extremely pleasant and almost stereotypically efficient. Room service was carried out with an exact professionalism I've never experienced anywhere else, though it's quite galling that they charge a €4 service charge - this really should be set at around 10 -15%. Other reviewers are right to say that there is a heavy smell of cigar smoke in the lobby, but for me this was just part of the quirky, yesteryears feel of the place. Another major plus for the hotel is the fact that it's so centrally located - the Zoological Garden station is just around the corner and only a few minutes away. All in all, a pretty impressive and rather luxurious stay. Not mind-blowingly great, but certainly a step above most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a huge room!”
Reviews.Author: gjck
Reviews.Content: We were impressed how close to the train station this hotel was. The room we received was very large and comfortable. This hotel was very close to the zoo and sights of "the old west Berlin".

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeSandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Savoy for 3 days in December 2007 and it was just lovely. I had my doubts following an earlier review about the standard of rooms and the smoky lobby. Most of this hotel has been refurbished, and we had two lovely rooms (in fact, we were upgraded to a fabulous suite when the hotel became aware that it was my birthday). The staff were extremely attentive at all times, and we certainly were not bothered by the smell of smoke in the lobby (but let's not forget it is a cigar bar!) The hotel is well-located for all the tourist attractions and we will certainly re-visit this hotel. We found two lovely restaurants within walking distance - Florian and Diekmann (which was recommended by the hotel, which was amazing as they offer a 'surprise' menu which I would highly recommend, but ask the hotel to pre-book.)

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this!”
Reviews.Author: C.Cambridge
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a brilliant location. Classic style in a quiet street just two minutes walk from Zoologischer Garten, just behind the Theater des Westens. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Rooms of good size and spotlessly clean, bathrooms basic but fine (great showers!). The restaurant was very impressive and exceptional value for money, and the cigar bar is worth a visit if only for the outstanding cocktails. We stayed for a long weekend and would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better This Time - Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler
Reviews.Content: Last year, I stayed at this hotel on business and gave it a less than stellar review. I re-booked and stayed again for two nights in mid-November, 2007 and must say that the hotel had addressed my main criticisim - in-room internet service. No problems this time, making my stay much more pleasant. You can't beat this hotel for location ( a quiet street off Kantstrasse - only two blocks from the madness of the K'dam.) This year, I found a very nice, inexpensive Chinese restaurant, one block up on Fasananstrasse - and a great flea market type antique store, just under the railway bridge on the same street. Lots of cool stuff for one or two euros. Proxmiity to Zoo Station and U-Bahn very helpful. I'm glad I returned and reacquainted myself with this place. Will always stay here when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A little bemused after reading the reviews”
Reviews.Author: b_m4
Reviews.Content: We were a little suprised - after reading the fantastic reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor we decided to book the hotel. As a reviewer mentioned below, the lobby and floors do smell overwhelmingly of cigar smoke. The dark red and gold decorations in the lobby and cigar bar make it a cosy place to be, but after 10 minutes in the bar my clothes and hair had soaked up the cigar smoke (even though no one was actually smoking!) - so not somewhere to visit for a pre-dinner drink. Or post-dinner come to think of it, particularly at 10 euros for the smallest measure of brandy ever seen! The staff were exceptionally polite and knowledgeable. The room and bathroom were very clean. However, our room didn't look as though it had been updated since the 1970's. The bedroom was very tired and not at all luxurious: the sheets were threadbare, the TV was old and the remote didn't work, the limewashed woodwork was old fashioned, the windows didn't keep out the noise of the traffic and trains on the railway overpass (which is only a few hundred yards away from the front of the hotel). All in all, it's not the end of the world, depending on your expectations! I would say that if you're not expecting anything special, then this is a good, functional and convenient base for a basic stay with great staff. However, if like us you were hoping for a boutique hotel after being charged £100 per night without breakfast then I'm not sure I'd recommend the Savoy as we felt very disappointed throughout our 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Savoy”
Reviews.Author: khhensley
Reviews.Content: We had an outstanding stay at the Savoy Hotel in Berlin. We booked this hotel three months in advance on hotels.com and paid US$95.00 per night, which was truly unbelievable. I would highly recommend staying here, owing to a number reasons: it was remarkably clean; staff was overly attentive; easily accessible location for exploring the city; fantastic cafes throughout the area that are open late; and it has a charming, historic feel. In addition, the hotel has a marvelous bar, which was always filled with locals, and has warm red hues and leather furniture throughout the public spaces. It is a very beautiful building! Our room, in the front of the hotel, had a small balcony, which was a wonderful way to take in each morning. It was also quiet and the bed was perfectly comfortable. The only complains were: the public computer’s Internet connection was very slow; we thought breakfast was included in the price of our room, but we were charged upon checkout (I’ll have to follow-up with hotels.com on that one); and the shower/bath was a little high from the ground, so if you have trouble lifting yourself into a higher plane, this might be an issue (it wasn't for us). Without any hesitation, we would stay at the Savoy while in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tourotrash
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Savoy Hotel in Berlin. It is a lovely old hotel with lots of charm and grace. Our room was a good size, clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and welcoming. The buffet breakfast included in the price was incredible. The location was fine. Overall a lovely place to stay. I only hope I get to Berlin again soon and definitely will stay at the Savoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location for shopping / dining”
Reviews.Author: RoverAll
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed 4 nights at the Savoy in November, 2006 (we had 4 rooms). The hotel is nicely situated between the Bahnhoff Zoo and Savignyplatz stations and is only two blocks from K'damm. There are a lot of restaurants around the corner on Kantstrasse and in the Savignyplatz area. Very comfortable beds and nice old-fashioned bathrooms. The rooms in the old section of the hotel have much more character than in the new section. The hotel restaurant is excellent - we had our best meal in Berlin there. The restaurant is booked well ahead of time, so make dinner reservations when you book your room! The included breakfast buffet is outstanding! The lobby is small and clubby-looking. The staff is excellent. The only downside to this hotel is the cigar-smoke. The hotel has a cigar bar next to the lobby and on weekends it is packed. The smell of cigar smoke is overwhelming in the lobby. On Friday and Saturday nights we could smell cigar smoke from our fourth floor rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition and style”
Reviews.Author: OliverAlbrecht
Reviews.Content: In the Savoy the traveller will find something very rare in Berlin: Tradition and Style. Built in 1929 it's the only one of the ancient Grand Hotels in the city not to be destroyed in World War II. So nothing is fake, it's all original Classical Moderne from the Twenties and Thirties.O.k., there is a bit patina on it, but this is what I like most ! You can sit near the fireplace in the lobby and imagine Greta Garbo, Thomas Mann or Billy Wilder going by - just a few of the famous guests the Savoy has welcomed. The elegantly decorated rooms are very spacious and so are the bathrooms. The hotel is situated in a calm street in the heart of Charlottenburg opposite the Delphi Movie Theater (an impressive cinema from the Twenties) and the Theater des Westens (a musical theater) and just 2 blocks from the famous Kurfürstendamm. Just a few steps along the street you will find the literature house with a cosy café in a most beautiful garden or you can stroll along Savignyplatz with it's antique bookstores and nice little restaurants - Berlin at it's best !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ModernArtStudio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin, Germany and the Savoy Hotel was quite nice. Be prepared that most Berlin hotels do NOT have air conditioning! The Savoy only has room suites on the 6th floor with air conditioning. We upgraded directly with the hotel. Our suite was decorated tastefully with Chagall prints and very comfortable. The hotel's cleanliness is superb. The 6th floor however, is NOT non-smoking; I was concerned about this, but it wasn't an issue. They have a wonderful hot breakfast buffet that was included in our stay, the dining room is elegant! I would certainly stay there again. The staff was very pleasant, and the location was perfect. I booked the hotel online before our trip. ++++

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaboecker
Reviews.Content: The Savoy is a very nice hotel with antique furniture but still a kind of trendy look. Rooms are very spacious but most bathrooms are in urgent need of remodelling (the existing ones are dating back to the 60s!). The staff is very friendly and efficient. The only real downside of this hotel is its bar: It is a cigar bar and there are always some people inside smoking cuban cigars which makes the air inside unbearable. Sometimes, the smoke is drifting through the lobby and makes the whole place very unpleasant. There is no non-smoking section in the bar and quite frankly, if you are not a smoker yourself, it is better to avoid the bar. They do serve drinks upon request in the lobby and you better ask them to do so. Breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevensusan
Reviews.Content: didn't know what to expect but was pleasantly surprised aboout this gem of a hotel. spacious, clean, comfortable rooms, outstanding breakfast buffet, attentive staff and in a good central location on a quiet street 2 blocks from the train station and poublic transportation. also, many cafes in the area. hotel price wqas a bargain

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved the Savoy, great rooms, wonderful breakfast, warm and friendly atmosphere, centrally located and quiet. The bar is may favourite place, great drinks and good cigars.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, patient, friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Savoy for a shopping weekend in Berlin and found it a superb elegant hotel. The lobby and the restaurant simply invite to sit down and relax. The room we stayed in was huge, clean and utterly comfortable. I have to mention the staff of the front desk and in the restaurant are efficient, fast, patient and friendly. Each of our requests were taken care of immediately. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not for non-smokers!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're a non-smoker, don't stay here! Although I was on the nonsmoking floor(5th) both the hallway and my room smelled of smoke. Why? The door of the cigar bar on the ground floor is left open and the smoke wafts through the hotel. Housekeeping leaves your windows open to air it out. One evening I returned to my room to find both windows open. The rooms need a re-do. The hotel was remodeling the 6th floor while I was there. Also, as it's near the Zoo rail station and the windows are not double-paned you will here trains all the time. The location is great. The restaurant staff is wonderful. The front desk staff was great during the week but the weekend front desk staff can be rude. Next time I'd stay at the more modern Ku'damm 101(owned by the same owners) or the Kempinski Bristol down the block.

HotelInfo.Name: Savoy Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Fasanenstrasse 9-10, 10623 Berlin, Germany
